intro: Amomum squarrosum, commonly known as the rough shellnut, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, rhizomatous growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in spikes. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes cultivated for its culinary and medicinal uses.
